name: Travelodge Hull South Cave

reviews.text: Hotel is about 15 miles outside of Hull by the side of the A63, rooms at the back were quiet. After booking on line I phoned to explain my mother who was with us was aged 85 and would like a room as close as possible to me. The receptionist was extremely helpful and booked adjacent rooms on the ground floor. The room was of Travelodge standard and was clean and tidy although there was a slight damp smell on occasion. The bathroom was in desperate need of a refurbishment as there was lots of black mould around the bath and tiled area and the flooring was coming away from the wall. Agree with the previous reviewer the television was out of the arc and not even a remote control. All in all ok if you paid £19, but a bit pricey at £45 which I paid booking at short notice.
reviews.title: In Need of a Refurb'

reviews.text: For £19.00 you can't expect much, and although it would be easy to pick fault with this hotel-the bed was a bit iffy-the bathroom in need of updating-the tv like a museum piece--this hotel was fine for a place to bed down for the night with the family
reviews.title: For £19 it was perfectly adequate

reviews.text: Room was cleanish not sure where I was supposed to put the 2nd child- luckily I brought the travel cot! The mattress must have been at least 20 years old it kinda disappeared when we led on it. Then there was the bathroom - yuk!! Mold on the ceiling and on the walls, there was no toilet roll holder the rolls were left on the side. We had booked for two nights but decided to only stay one.
reviews.title: Needs a good clean and some basic decorating!

reviews.text: The staff were very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Travelodge from hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked for York on website, paid and got a postcode, no mention it was full and we were relocated to nearest one.. We ended via sat nav on a dark dual carriage way in hull. First room was in basement and had black mould rising all up the Walls, it was smelly and damp, this was midnight when we arrived, the man on the desk was helpful and moved me and my family to another room, slightly better but very dated, we paid extra online for 3 course breakfast at the restaurant next door, in the morning we got a knock on the door, i opened it to find 4 plastic bags containing a cardboard cup with a tea bag, sugar,milk inside plus a cereal bar and a yogurt, when I complained they said they had fallen out with the restaurant and because we booked online there's was no refund!!! I complained via email on return home and heard nothing back!!! Awful customer service!!!
reviews.title: Well worth visiting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at South Cave on October 25th and October 29th at either end of our P&O MIni Cruise from nearby Hull to Zeebrugge (for Bruges). This is the third time that we have used this Travelodge and I wanted to share my experiences.
reviews.title: A Typical No Frills Travelodge!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, location-wise, for a stop-over, it is fine, it is located at the intersection between the M62 and A63, about 15 minutes (by good roads) to Hull. For meals, there is a very good Little Chef right next door to the Lodge with a good selection of breakfast and lunch and a limited range of alcoholic drinks (also the service is generally good, although when busy, we did have some mistakes, for which we were not charged). For anything other than a stop-over, the location is very remote and there are no nearby facilities, aside from the Little Chef and the filling station. It is very much a place where you can stop after a long drive or use as a base to tour this pretty part of Yorkshire.
reviews.title: Absolute Bargain .. For Nine Quid !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of the rooms themselves, this is one of the older Travelodges, of the style originally built, with 2 floors of 20 identical family rooms, which have a double bed and bed-settee. The usual Travelodge Facilities are present, such as TV with satellite, wifi, tea and coffee making facilities and en suite bathroom. Both rooms we had were upper floor, facing the road (27 and 29) and we never had a bother with the noise and had a good pair of blackout curtains which helped with getting a good nights sleep. From our room, we could also see the car and keep an eye on it.
reviews.title: Little Chef - a lesson in service to places ten times the price; Travelodge just fine
I would sleep in my car before I stayed here again
reviews.text: Both rooms were clean and well presented. I was a bit surprised with some of the penny pinching which is happening. When in Room 27, we had plenty of towels for us both, but on our way home in Room 29, we had 1 bath sheet and 1 hand towel. In both cases, i noticed they were using Tesco Value Loo rolls and there were some splash marks on the wall under the desk in Room 29 which had not been sponged. The top of the TV was very dusty and only 1 pillow was supplied each. The mattresses in both rooms were very tired and very uncomfortable to sleep on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be careful at Check in that you have all hotel rules explained to you. Jeff, the operative who checked us in to Room 27 told us all of the procedures in detail and was very helpful and professional, but the lady who checked us in to Room 29, did not explain even how to get to our room and almost threw the room key across to us!!!
reviews.title: Rats? Where? Rabbits, more like!

reviews.text: On my travels again again used this one for an overnight stop.
reviews.title: Good value again

reviews.text: Some mention of tired rooms but not that bad.
reviews.title: Good Travelodge

reviews.text: Following reviews on TA asked for an upper rear room and nice reception girls sorted it.
reviews.title: Good for a night

reviews.text: Eat next door lovely little chef.
reviews.title: Good clean room for a stopover

reviews.text: Room clean, tidy and hade some nice smell,
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived 19.30 weather freezing, minus 1 degree the rooms tiny heater in the far corner of the room was not on and it took 3 hours before we could take off our coats and brave changing for bed. The next morning the water was not hot enough for a shower and no bathroom heating either, even the towel was too cold to place on naked skin. We boiled the kettle to warm up the water in the sink ...just like camping.. we though that penguins might pop out when we moved the shower curtain.
reviews.title: OK for penguins

reviews.text: Such a shame as in summer it was a nice place to stay
reviews.title: Not bad at all, ideal for overnight.

reviews.text: Can't believe the bad reviews this hotel has had. The other reviewers have obviously not stayed in the Travelodge at Crewe Bartholomley - if they had they'd think this place was a palace!
reviews.title: OMG - Worst stay ever!

reviews.text: Admittedly our rooms were not quite ready on arrival ( due to a late delivery of linen) but the reception staff worked hard to get them ready quickly and brought extra towels immediately on request. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and in good condition. My husband did find the bed a little uncomfortable but perhaps that is because we are used to a firmer mattress. Great pub ithe village of South Cave - (Fox and Coney) avoid the adjacent Little Chef - it's pretty awful!!
reviews.title: Give it a miss

reviews.text: Ideal for a one night stay - no real complaints.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

likes.liked: — Near where I needed to be and allows pets
likes.disliked: — Surrounding area is unsecured and dirty

aka: Travelodge Hull South Cave Hotel South Cave
